EcmaScript6 Examples - destructuring assignment

The destructuring assignment in EcmaScript6 is one way to initialize variables as an array. Is possible to inform more than one variable in just one declaration.

Let's see an example: 

                
                    var destructuring_simple = function(){
                        let [a, b] = [5, 6];

                        console.log(a);
                        console.log(b);

                        let [c,,d] = [1,2,3];

                        console.log(c);
                        console.log(d);
                    };

                    destructuring_simple();

The most simple way to pass data as an array to variables is creating an array of variables on the left and on the right to pass the array of values. Pay attention in second example where is a gap in the middle of arrays. It is totally possible to do when using the destructuring assignment. 

                
                    var array_return = function(){
                        return [5,6];
                    };

                    var destructuring_function = function(){
                        let [a, b] = array_return();

                        console.log(a);
                        console.log(b);
                    };

                    destructuring_function();

The second example is pretty similar to first example, but the data came from a function which return an array. 

                
                    var object_return = function(){
                        return {
                            firstName: 'Rodrigo',
                            lastName: 'Morais'
                        };
                    };

                    var destructuring_object = function(){
                        let {firstName: first_name, lastName: last_name} = object_return();

                        console.log(first_name);
                        console.log(last_name);

                        let {firstName, lastName} = object_return();

                        console.log(firstName);
                        console.log(lastName);
                    };

                    destructuring_object();

Instead of to populate an array of variables is possible to populate an object. In this example a function returns an object, and the destructuring assignment is created like an object. Pay attention because the first properties are always the properties returned from function and the second one are the properties which will be populated. Look the second example, when the properties have the same name is not necessary to declare they twice.
